item.title: On stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: How AI is forcing late-stage startups to rewire GTM — or be left behind
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: AI isn’t just disrupting products — it’s upending how companies sell, scale, and succeed. At TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, happening October 27–29 in San Francisco, we’re diving deep into how late-stage startups are navigating this shift. Catch this dynamic panel on the Going Public Stage, where three seasoned leaders will explore how AI is transforming go-to-market […]

item.title: VSCO’s iPhone camera app is now available globally
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Photo editing and sharing app VSCO is making its iOS camera app, Capture, available across the world, following a limited launch in June, when the app came to Ireland, Australia and New Zealand.

item.title: 21-year-old MIT dropouts raise $32M at $300M valuation led by Insight
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Karun Kaushik and Selin Kocalar weren’t planning to raise a Series A so soon. Their AI compliance startup, Delve, which announced a $3 million seed round in January, was growing fast and signing customers at a steady clip. Then, inbound interest started rolling in, COO Kocalar told TechCrunch. Delve, which automates regulatory compliance with AI […]

item.title: Telegram’s crypto wallet launches in the US
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Telegram is expanding access to its crypto wallet for its 87 million users in the US.

item.title: Betaworks’ third fund closes at $66M to invest in early-stage AI startups
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: New York City-based Betaworks has closed its $66 million Fund III, which will focus on investing in early-stage AI companies.  Betaworks has been investing in AI since at least 2016 and, through its investment program Camp, has backed companies such as Huggingface and Granola. Jordan Crook, a partner at the firm (and former TechCrunch employee), […]

item.title: Nevoya raises $9.3M as its EV truck fleet reaches cost parity with diesel
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: All-electric truck fleet startup Nevoya has landed a fresh round of capital and plans to expand.

item.title: Lucid Air owners will be able to use Tesla Superchargers from July 31
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Owners of the Lucid Air sedan will be able to charge their luxury EVs at thousands of Tesla Supercharger stations in North America starting July 31. But there is a notable caveat: Lucid Air vehicles won't be able to charge as fast as Tesla vehicles.

item.title: Amazon backs programmable optics startup Lumotive
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Lumotive reopened its February Series B round to add Amazon's Industrial Innovation Fund and ITHCA Group, increasing the size of the round to $59 million.

item.title: This startup thinks email could be the key to usable AI agents
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Mixus' AI agent platform not only keeps humans in the workflow, it also allows those humans to interact with agents directly from their email or Slack.

item.title: Three things veteran planetary health investors look for in a startup
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: RA Capital Planetary Health closed a $120 million fund. Here's the rubric two investors use to determine where to place their fund's money.

item.title: Robot guard dogs help Asylon raise a $26M Series B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: DroneDogs can be sent to places unsafe for humans or real dogs and can do tasks like dangerous chemical detection.

item.title: Latent Labs launches web-based AI model to democratize protein design
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The company claims that its model achieved state of the art on specific metrics.

item.title: Instead of selling to Meta, AI chip startup FuriosaAI signed a huge customer
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: South Korean AI chip startup FuriosaAI announced a partnership on Tuesday to supply its AI chip, RNGD, to enterprises using LG AI Research‘s recently unveiled EXAONE platform. RNGD is optimized for running large language models (LLMs) and just last week, the Korean tech giant LG unveiled its next-generation hybrid AI model EXAONE 4.0. The collaboration […]

item.title: Tesla opens retro-futuristic diner as Elon Musk hints at more locations
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The Tesla Diner & Drive-In officially opened Monday, and it seems Elon Musk is planning for more.

item.title: OpenAI and Google outdo the mathletes, but not each other
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI and Google's AI models achieved impressive results in a difficult math competition, but disputed how the other got their score.

item.title: Serial spyware founder Scott Zuckerman wants the FTC to unban him from the surveillance industry
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The spyware maker was banned from the surveillance industry in 2021, but was caught flouting the ban less than a year later. Now the founder wants the ban lifted altogether.

item.title: ChatGPT users send 2.5 billion prompts a day
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: ChatGPT receives 2.5 billion prompts from global users every day.

item.title: Hackers exploiting SharePoint zero-day seen targeting government agencies
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Thousands of SharePoint servers could be vulnerable to hackers, according to cybersecurity firms.

item.title: 72% of US teens have used AI companions, study finds
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: By "companion," the study is focused on AI chatbots that are designed for users to have more personal conversations with, not AI assistants that work as homework helpers, image generators, or voice assistants that just answer questions.

item.title: Figma’s Dylan Field will cash out about $60M in IPO, with Index, Kleiner, Greylock, Sequoia all selling, too
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Figma is allowing existing shareholders to sell more stock than the company will in its IPO.
